description: A bullish reversal pattern with lower highs and lower lows converging into a narrowing wedge sloping downward. Despite falling prices, selling pressure weakens, leading to eventual upside breakout.

structure: Both upper and lower trendlines slope downward
Requires at least 5 touches (2-3 on each trendline)
Pattern duration: 3-6 months on daily, 1-4 weeks on 4H
Slope of upper trendline steeper than lower (creates narrowing)
Forms after downtrend or near lows
volume: Each decline should show weaker volume than previous
Decreasing volume indicates weakening selling despite lower prices
Strong volume spike on upside breakout confirms validity
indicators: RSI showing bullish divergence critical (higher lows while price makes lower lows)
MACD histogram showing rising peaks (momentum improving)
Stochastic making higher lows while price makes lower lows
Momentum turning up while still inside wedge
timeframe: Very reliable on daily and weekly charts

invalidation_signals: Volume increasing during declines (strong selling = bearish)
Price breaks downward through bottom trendline
Trendlines not converging (parallel = channel, not wedge)
Forms in uptrend (falling wedges need downtrend to reverse)
Too short duration (<3 weeks on daily)
common_mistakes: Confusing with descending triangle (flat bottom, not sloping down)
Ignoring volume - declining volume is essential
Trying to buy inside wedge before breakout
Expecting immediate breakout - can extend for months

trade_setup.entry: Enter long on break and close above upper trendline with volume
trade_setup.stop_loss: Place below recent swing low or below lower wedge trendline
trade_setup.target: Measure wedge base (widest part), project upward from breakout
